question: when were the words under god added to the pledge
chain_of_thought_result: The words "under God" were added to the Pledge of Allegiance on June 14, 1954. This addition was part of a campaign led by various religious and patriotic groups during the Cold War, aiming to distinguish the United States from the atheistic Soviet Union. The change was officially signed into law by President Dwight D. Eisenhower.
